content:
At a high level, what is the relationship between components defined in both lean4 and std4 such as Lean.HashMap and Std.HashMap?

Context: I am working on documenting examples of Std.Hashmap and am curious

The original purpose of the split was so that Std could add more invariants and correctness proofs, while lean can continue making modifications for use in the compiler without impacting consumers of Std. Things in Std are changing rapidly though, and there is a good chance that the two types will be reunified in the future.
For now, the two are basically a copy paste job, with most changes being internal only. They have exactly the same interface, but Std.HashMap has a few more operations.
Austin Letson has marked this topic as resolved.
